projectdetail1421.title: Dublin Senior Living

details.Application Type: Planned Development Rezone and Site Development Review Permit

projectdetail1421.description: South Bay Partners proposes to develop a 5.74-acre site located at 5751 Arnold Road within the Hacienda Gateway Planning Subarea of the Eastern Dublin Specific Plan. The proposal includes a two story 152-unit senior living project consisting of 114 assisted living units and 38 memory care units with associated common space amenity areas. The application includes planning entitlements for a Planned Development Rezone and Site Development Review Permit.

projectdetail1402.title: Regional Street Senior Affordable Housing

details.Application Type: Site Development Review Permit

projectdetail1402.description: Eden Housing proposes to develop a 1.32-acre site located at 6541-6543 Regional Street within the Downtown Dublin Specific Plan Transit-Oriented District and walking distance of the West Dublin/Pleasanton BART Station. The Regional Senior Affordable Housing project consists of 113 units of housing to serve low- and very low-income seniors and includes amenity space and parking.

projectdetail1387.title: Dublin Transit Center Parking Garage

details.Application Type: n/a

Applicant.name: County of Alameda General Services Agency

Project Planner.name: Bernadette Delgado - Medical Capital Program Manager, County of Alameda General Services Agency

docs.name: Environmental Document: Alameda County Board of Supervisors June 4, 2019 Agenda

projectdetail1387.description: The proposed Dublin Transit Center Parking Garage Project near the Dublin/Pleasanton BART station will have a capacity for over 500 parking spaces for Tri-Valley area commuters, including priority vanpool parking and Electric Vehicle (EV) charging stations. The project promote and increase BART ridership and to advance the Dublin/Pleasanton BART Capacity Improvement and Congestion Reduction Program. Alameda County’s General Services Agency will be responsible for day-to-day management of garage design and construction. For additional information on this project contact:

projectdetail1300.description: Site Development Review Permit for modifications to the former Hooter’s building, including creating two tenant spaces, a 568-square-foot addition, a new trash enclosure, and outdoor seating. The request also includes a Conditional Use Permit to establish a drive-thru and associated parking.

projectdetail1189.title: East Ranch (Croak Property)

details.Application Type: Stage II Planned Development, Vesting Tentative Tract Map and Heritage Tree Permit
details.General Plan Land Use: Low-Density Residential, Medium-Density Residential, Rural Residential/Agriculture, Parks/Public Recreation, Open Space, Semi-Public

Applicant.name: Pam Nieting, Trumark Homes, LLC
Applicant.address: 3001 Bishop Drive, Suite 100, San Ramon, CA 94583

projectdetail1189.description: The Applicant, Trumark Homes, LLC, filed a Stage II Planned Development, Vesting Tentative Tract Map and Heritage Tree Removal Permit Application for the development of 165.5-acre site with a 573-unit residential project within six neighborhoods (including two options for 108 Medium Density Residential units as either market rate or age-qualified and 473 Low-Density Single-Family Residential units), two neighborhood parks 11.5 acres, and a two-acre Semi-Public Site. The proposed development includes seven home programs, ranging from three to ten units per acre, and designed with four architecture styles: Traditional Farmhouse, Modern Farmhouse, California Revival, and Contemporary, as shown in the project plans. The use of the Semi-Public Site has not been determined.

projectdetail1128.title: Cambria Hotel

Applicant.address: 1840 San Miguel Drive, Ste. 206, Walnut Creek, CA 94596

docs.name: Planning Commission April 28, 2020 Agenda & Staff Report

projectdetail1128.description: Site Development Review Permit to construct a new 138 room hotel in the parking lot south of the existing office building (Corrie Center). The proposed 4-story hotel is located above a 2-story parking structure to be shared with the existing office building. The applications include a minor use permit for shared parking, Heritage Tree Removal Permit to remove two Coast redwoods, community benefit agreement and related improvements to landscaping and parking.

projectdetail1087.title: Kaiser Commercial – Nissan

projectdetail1075.title: Westin Hotel

details.Application Type: TMAP, SDR, Stage 2 PD

Applicant.name: Charles Patel
Applicant.address: 3657 Old Santa Rita Rd, Pleasanton, CA 94588

projectdetail1075.description: The Westin Hotel project is a proposal for a Tentative Parcel Map, Site Development Review Permit, and a Stage 2 Development Plan for a 163,133 square foot, 6-story hotel. The site consists of a 5.88-acre parcel located at the southeast corner of Campus Drive and Altamirano Avenue, adjacent to the existing East Dublin BART Station. The hotel will include a 5,254 square foot restaurant, a ballroom, 2 large meeting rooms, and 198 hotel rooms.

projectdetail1071.title: Quarry Lane Preschool

details.Application Type: Site Development Review

projectdetail1071.description: The property owner, Dr Sabri Arac, is requesting approval of a Site Development Review Permit to construct a new 26,000-square-foot building to house the Quarry Lane Pre-School. The proposed facility will include 15 classrooms, activity rooms (i.e., music, library, art and staff rooms) and related site improvements including onsite parking, frontage and landscape improvements, and a 10,000-square-foot outdoor children’s play area including play structures.

projectdetail998.description: The proposed Ashton at Dublin Station project is located at the northwest corner of DeMarcus Boulevard and Campbell Lane within the Transit Center. The site has a General Plan and Eastern Dublin Specific Plan land use designation of High Density Residential (25+ units per acre) and Planned Development Zoning with a Stage 1 Development Plan that permits a high density residential development.

projectdetail971.title: Grafton Plaza Daycare & Retail

details.Application Type: Planned Development Amendment; Site Development Review; and Minor Use Permit

projectdetail971.description: The Applicant, Eddie Li, requested approval to construct three commercial buildings with a total of 31,860 square feet (sf), including two retail buildings (16,038 sf and 6,055 sf) and one daycare building (9,767 sf) on a 3.68-acre site located at the southeast corner of Dublin Boulevard and Grafton Street. The application included amendments to the existing Planned Development Zoning Stage 1 and Stage 2 Development Plans, a Site Development Review Permit for the proposed improvements, and a Minor Use Permit for a parking reduction for shared parking.

projectdetail572.description: Site Development Review to demolish an existing 200,000 square foot warehouse and construct a 499 unit residential apartment complex.

projectdetail560.description: Site Development Review permit to demolish an existing 5,000 square foot building (formerly Coco’s Bakery Restaurant) and construct a new commercial pad building totaling 9,000 square feet. Includes associated site improvements, outdoor seating areas, parking and landscaping.

Applicant.address: 500 La Gonda Way, Suite 100, Danville, CA 94526

projectdetail506.description: Phase1 of the Boulevard project include 453 units and landscape improvements. Design review for the first six residential neighborhoods (Phases 1A and 1B) were approved by the Planning Commission on June 14, 2016.

projectdetail486.title: Boulevard (Dublin Crossing) Phase 2 & 3

details.Application Type: Site Development Review, Vesting Tenative Tract Map

Applicant.name: Joe Guerra, Dublin Crossing LLC/Brookfield Residential
Applicant.address: 500 La Gonda Way, Suite 100, Danville, CA 94526

docs.name: Planning Commission Staff Report 04.11.17 Study Session

projectdetail486.description: Multi-phased development comprised of up to 1,995 residential units, up to 200,000 square feet of commercial uses, 35 acres of public parkland, a 12-acre elementary school site and related infrastructure. The overall project specific plan (Dublin Crossing Specific Plan) was approved in 2013. Together, Phases 2 and 3 propose a total of 791 units in 12 neighborhoods. Phase 2 is comprised of 508 units on approximately 36.25 acres and Phase 3 is comprised of 283 units on approximately 18.22 acres. The Planning Commission held two study sessions on April 11 and April 25 to review Phases 2 and 3.

projectdetail71.title: Boulevard (Dublin Crossing)

details.Application Type: General Plan Amendment, Planned Development Rezone with Stage 1 and 2 Development Plan, Vesting Tentative Tract Map

Applicant.name: Joe Guerra, Dublin Crossing LLC/Brookfield Residential
Applicant.address: 500 La Gonda Way, Suite 100, Danville, CA 94526

projectdetail71.description: Multi-phased development comprised of up to 1,995 residential units, up to 200,000 square feet of commercial uses, 35 acres of public parkland, a 12-acre elementary school site and related infrastructure. The overall project specific plan (Dublin Crossing Specific Plan) was approved in 2013. Site improvements for the first phase of development is underway. Design review for the first six residential neighborhoods (Phases 1A and 1B) were approved by the Planning Commission on June 14, 2016. On May 9, 2017 the Planning Commission approved the design of the 12 residential neighborhoods in Phases 2 and 3 and on May 8, 2018, the Planning Commission approved the design of the remaining six residential neighborhoods in Phases 4 and 5. The project is currently under construction.

projectdetail150.title: Schaefer Ranch Unit 3

details.Application Type: General Plan Amendment, Planned Development Rezone, Site Development Review, Tentative Map and CEQA Addendum

Applicant.name: Louis Parsons, Discovery Builders
Applicant.address: 4061 Port Chicago Hwy, Suite H, Concord, CA 94520

projectdetail150.description: The Schaefer Unit 3 project included approval of a General Plan Amendment and Planned Development Zoning with a related Stage 1 and Stage 2 Development Plan to change the land use designation and zoning of 17.30 acres designated as Estate Residential and originally approved for 6 residential estate lots and common areas, to 7.04 acres designated as Single-Family Residential for 18 single-family detached homes and 10.26 acres designated as Open Space. This proposal results in a total of 418 homes (a net increase of 12 homes) within the Schaefer Ranch project. The application also included a Site Development Review Permit and Vesting Tentative Map for the proposed homes on the 18 lots.

projectdetail30.description: The City received an application from IKEA to construct a store and a commercial center on a 27.5 acre site at 5144 and 5344 Martinelli Way. The proposed project is for up to 410,000 square feet of commercial uses includes a 317,000 square foot IKEA store with integrated podium parking and a 93,000 square foot commercial center with a mix of retail and restaurant spaces. The updated site plan submitted to the City can be reviewed by clicking on the thumbnail below.
